overview: The purpose and intent of this measure is to: amend the definition of "debilitating medical condition" under the Uniform Controlled Substances Act; amend the definition of "waiting room" under the Medical Cannabis Dispensary System law; repeal the requirement that a provider-patient relationship be established in person; and allow dispensaries to purchase cannabis and manufactured cannabis products from another dispensary (HB302). The measure also seeks to prohibit persons from operating a medical cannabis dispensary or cultivating cannabis without a license, establish criminal penalties, and establish a cannabis cultivator license to authorize the cultivation and distribution of cannabis plants (HB302). It will also appropriate funds for the Department of Attorney General to enforce, and mitigate nuisances relating to, chapter 329D, HRS (HB302).
appropriations: This measure will appropriate funds out of the Medical Cannabis Registry and Regulation Special Fund for the Department of Attorney General to enforce, and mitigate nuisances relating to, chapter 329D, HRS (HB302). The appropriation for the Department of the Attorney General shall be expended by the Attorney General (HB302). The specific dollar amount of the appropriation is not specified in the provided document.

agency_impact: This measure will require the Department of Health to issue a cease and desist notice to violators before initiating criminal proceedings and to establish a cannabis cultivator license (HB302). The measure specifies that the Department of the Attorney General's Drug Nuisance Abatement Unit may enforce nuisances relating to chapter 329D, HRS (HB302). The appropriation for the Department of the Attorney General is to be expended by the Attorney General to enforce, and mitigate nuisances relating to, chapter 329D, HRS (HB302).
economic_impact: Your Committees find that the State's medical dispensary program is suffering from regulatory barriers that make operations difficult to sustain while facing increasing threats of competition from the unregulated market (HB302). This measure will lower the barrier to entry for patients to access the legal dispensary system while maintaining quality standards for licensees (HB302). This is intended to ensure access to clean and tested cannabis for patients (HB302).
policy_impact: This measure amends the definition of "debilitating medical condition" under the Uniform Controlled Substances Act and the definition of "waiting room" under the Medical Cannabis Dispensary System law, and repeals the requirement that a provider-patient relationship be established in person (HB302). It establishes a new cannabis cultivator license and establishes criminal penalties for operating a medical cannabis dispensary or cultivating cannabis without a license (HB302). The measure was amended to clarify that the state of mind requirement for the offense of operating a dispensary without a license from the Department of Health is intentionally, knowingly, or recklessly (HB302).
revenue_sources: The measure authorizes expenditures from the Medical Cannabis Registry and Regulation Special Fund to fund programs for the mitigation and abatement of nuisances relating to chapter 329D, Hawaii Revised Statutes (HRS) (HB302). It also appropriates funds out of the Medical Cannabis Registry and Regulation Special Fund for the Department of Attorney General to enforce, and mitigate nuisances (HB302). No other sources of revenue are identified in the provided text.
